titleStmt.title: By the Lords-Justices and Council. A proclamation Charles Porter Tho: Coningesby. Whereas all due care has been taken for the keeping up and preserving the markets in all parts of this kingdom under their Majesties obedience, whereto all persons may resort with freedom and liberty of trade and commerce; ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook assignee of Benjamin Tooke, printer to the King and Queen at thier Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening words of text.
"Given at the Council-Chamber in Dublin 25th. day of September, 1691.".
For the encouragement of markets and agriculture.--Steele.
Steele notation: Arms 201. the said p.2) upon their.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
